On 12/16/10 1:39 AM, yotpo.official wrote:
> Hi,
> I'm pretty new to Heritrix 3 and despite my very good impression of the code and it's ability, I'm having problems with a couple of things:
>
> 1. How do I config the cxml file so I will crawl only in a specific domain, lets say http://example.com and only in sub domains of it?
> meaning if there is a url ads.google/.... i dont want to even fetch it.

See the first Frequently-Asked-Question listed on the project wiki, 
'unexpected offsite content':

https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/FAQs

> 2. How do i make the multiple queuing to work? does it happens automatically?

What do you mean by "multiple queueing"?

> 3. I configed the cxml file so I wont process all the jpg/gif/png files but my logs still show me (Mimetypes) i process them.  this is what I did:
> <bean class="org.archive.modules.deciderules.MatchesListRegexDecideRule">
>            <property name="decision" value="REJECT"/>
>       <!--<property name="listLogicalOr" value="true" />  -->
>       <!--<property name="regexList">
>             <list>
>                   <value>.*(?i)(\.css(\?.*)?)$</value>
>                   <value>.*(\.bmp|\.gif|\.jpg|\.png|bmp))$</value>
>             </list>
>            </property>  -->
>      </bean>
>
> what is my mistake??

A definite problem is that your 'regexList' property element is inside 
XML comment markers -- "<!-- ... -->" -- so is not a part of the active 
configuration.

A possible problem could be the relative location of this rule with 
respect to other scope rules; if this comes early, but then a later rule 
ACCEPTs the same URIs, the later rule wins.

You regexes also seem a bit suboptimal -- the CSS part could be mixed in 
with the others, BMP doesn't need to be listed twice, you may want the 
case-insensitive indicator for all suffixes, etc. -- but looks vaguely 
functional for your purposes.

- Gordon @ IA
